Events for your health and wellbeing

What’s happening in my library?

We host a wide range of activities and events across all our libraries.

Bury St Edmunds Library Bury Open Space: A space to drop in to listen, chat and think... free tea and coffee provided. All welcome. Monday 1400-1600

Great Cornard Library Leading Lives - a general interest activity and social session for adults with additional needs (term time only) Monday 1345-1445
Hadleigh Library Suffolk Bereavement Support - see http://www.suffolkbereavement.org.uk for more details and to reserve a free place please call Patrick or Margaret on 01206 299832 2nd and 4th Thursday of the month 1330-1530
Hadleigh Library Beginners' Pilates class - £9 a session or £28 for four sessions. For more information please call Gee on 07549524447 or email jeanettemayes@me.com Monday 1800-1900
Halesworth Library Seated exercise: get trim and toned without leaving your chair - exercises to raise your heart rate and increase strength - please contact the library to book a session - £4 per session, or £6 for a seated exercise and I move freely session on the same day Thursday 0930-1015
Halesworth Library I Move Freely: gentle seated stretching and toning exercises for all - help improve mobility and flexibility in shoulders, hips, knees and ankles - please contac tthe library to book a session - £4 per session, or £6 for a seated exercise and I move freely session on the same day Thursday 1030-1130
Haverhill Library Open space: drop in for health info, activities and chat. All welcome. Free tea and coffee provided. Fridays from 4 August 1230-1430
Ipswich County Library Lifting Spirits with Suffolk Family Carers - women's singing project for carers - speak to your Suffolk Family Carers contact if you require respite care to attend every other Monday 1920-2120
Ipswich County Library Music in Mind with Suffolk Family Carers - singing for family carers, with a mental health focus - speak to your Suffolk Family Carers contact if you require respite care to attend every other Monday 1400-1600
Ipswich County Library Stitching Time: learn basic techniques on a sewing machine - £30 for a six-week course starting 9 May - please book in advance at the library - fabric provided but bring your own if you wish - no session 30 May Tuesday 1300-1500
Ipswich County Library Open space: drop in for health info and chats. All welcome. See our spring 2017 timetable Wednesday 1300-1500
Ipswich County Library Slimming World: held in the lecture hall Thursday 0930-1130
Ipswich County Library Slimming World: held in the lecture hall Thursday 1200-1330

Woodbridge Library Mindfulness and Meditation - Meeting Room, drop-in, £10. Relax and unwind to combat stress, anxiety and worry through mindfulness and meditation. All welcome. Email debrawoodbridge@gmail.com or call 01394 450066; http://www.harnessinghappiness.co.uk - sessions on Mondays 15 and 22 May and 5, 12, 19 and 26 June Monday 1115-1245
Woodbridge Library Chair based exercises - one-hour tai chi/qi gong/meditation-based exercises for older people and those recovering from illness or injury - £3 per session - please register your interest by emailing kellie.dimmock@suffolklibraries.co.uk weekly, day TBA n/a

What’s happening in my community?

As well as the activities and events in your local library, there are lots of other things happening in your community. If you are doing anything to support mental health and wellbeing, please contact us.

About

My name is Sarah Lungley and I am the coordinator for Suffolk Libraries Mental Health and Wellbeing Information Service.

My role is to help provide information on local services and to promote events in our libraries and the community that can support mental health and wellbeing.

The service also aims to support our library staff, to ensure they are able to access useful and up-to-date information for our customers should they request it.

Libraries are a fantastic resource, not only for books and information but for community, friendships and fun too. So pop in to your local branch or explore our website to find out more about what we do – we hope to see you soon!

Privacy & cookies

By using our site you agree to our use of cookies. Find out what cookies we use, how they affect you and how you can control them: our cookie policy.
